game.name: Tant Fant
game.history: Tant Fant a 2-player abstract strategy game from India, documented in Bengal between the late 18th and early 20th century. It is similar to Achi or Three Men’s Morris.
game.board: Tant Fant is a movement-only game played on a 3x3 board, with an additional X-shape in the center that allows pieces in the corner to move to the center position.
game.pieces: (X and O) || (Black and White) || (etc. of 2 types).
game.tomove: Move one of your pieces to an empty adjacent square, denoted by the lines on the board. There will always be a move available if the game has not ended yet.
game.towin: A player wins if they get 3 pieces in a row horizontally, vertically, or diagonally, with the condition that the 3-in-a-row is not the original starting position of their pieces.

strategy.name: Delayed Middle Capture
strategy.description: Since any piece can reach the middle position from any other point on the board, it is useful to develop all three pieces adjacent to the middle / on diagonals, and move into the middle as your winning move.

variant.name: Diagonal Win Condition
variant.description: Only diagonal 3-in-a-row’s are able to win the game, instead of any 3-in-a-row != start position.

variant.name: Diamond Movement Path
variant.description: A diamond-shaped move pattern along the board instead of an X-shaped one in the center.
